page.title: 17HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: {WINTERSLOW SCHOOL}WAS BUILT IN 1856. ALL THE EXPENSES WERE PAID FOR BY FRANCES THOMAS EGERTON OF ROCHE COURT. THE LAND WAS GIVEN BY LORD HOLLAND. THE BUILDING THAT WAS BUILT FIRST IS STILL ERECT.THERE IS A PLAQUE OUTSIDE TO COMMEMORATE WHEN THE SCHOOL WAS FIRST BUILT.{ { { { THE PHEASANT HOTEL }USED TO BE A TRAVELLERS' LODGE.IT WAS A HALFWAY STOPPING PLACE BETWEEN SALISBURY,WINTERSLOW OR MIDDLE WALLOP. AS YOU GO IN THE DOOR ON YOUR LEFT IS A PLAQUE WITH THE WORDS HAZLITT COCKTAIL BAR.IT IS NAMED AFTER THE FAMOUS POET. THE PHEASANT WAS USED AS A COACH STATION AND MAIL STOP EARLIER IN HISTORY.
